Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@wolfgang there is no reported issue with the Komodo paper wallet, but there could be problems based on its source
https://www.coindesk.com/researcher-discovers-serious-vulnerability-in-paper-crypto-wallet-website
Our recommendation is to use one of these:
```
- Verus Agama (https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.6.0.13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview)
- KomodoOcean QT (https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/folders/29000055193)
- Ledger Hardware wallet (Make sure the Ledger seed hasn't been input in the unsahe versions of Agama) 
```

Author: Archimedes#7830
Content: your paperwallet should be safe ‚Ñ¢

Author: Archimedes#7830
Content: that incident had to do with the source not beeing identical with the actual code on the website

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: @gcharang I reported that story a few weeks ago. It seems the problem (only in recent months) was for users who loaded the webpage and then disconnected from internet, that is not the recommended way to use. Downloading from github was safe. So Komodo paperwallet was forked long before the vulnerability happened and was downloaded from github, should be safe ‚úå

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I only have this right now, waiting for confirmation from @Decker

Content: but as to vulnerabilities, there are none known at this point to my knowledge

Content: yes, there are no known vulns that's for sure
